channel.title: Please lock, fixed [ty pure n skillz!]
channel.description:
[i]Problem[/i]: My server will show no errors when starting up, and will say this usual 'Starting PimpScape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594,' but neither I or anyone else can log on either.
[i]What I think might be wrong:[/i] Well earlier today when MoparScape was having weird errors I went and looked up the 'Red X' and one of the potential causes was 'Java is corrupted.' so I uninstalled my old Java and re-installed it (with a newer, more updated version)
Version this morning was: 1.5.0_09 Version now is: 1.6.0_01
I re-read the tutorials on how to make the server and re-did the steps that I could, but no luck.
Can anyone help ???

edit2:maybe i should go back to java 5 ?

THANK YOU PLAY N SKILLZ!~! you rockk!

Ok, so compiler:

@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Runserver:

@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause

And I’m gonna check my port right now.

EDIT: The port checker isn’t working

@RapeScapePK wrote:

[quote=“Play N Skillz, post:23, topic:78673”]Not exactly… I’m sorry what’s your current error atm?
Do you need codes for your compile.bat and runserver.bat and have you checked to see if your port is available to accept connections? Also, have you disabled your firewall and added your port in the ‘Exceptions’ tab?[/quote]

Error is that my PimpScape source refuses to accept any connections from anyone ever since I updated to Java 6u1 this morning.
How can I check if my port is able to accept connections?
Yes, I added my port in the ‘exceptions’ tab and forwarded the port through my router.

item.title: Please lock, fixed [ty pure n skillz!]
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Not exactly… I’m sorry what’s your current error atm?
Do you need codes for your compile.bat and runserver.bat and have you checked to see if your port is available to accept connections? Also, have you disabled your firewall and added your port in the ‘Exceptions’ tab?

Have you been compiling and using runserver.bat. Funny question, but commonly mistaken. You compile, then close that window, and then double-click runserver.bat and minimize that window.

Read full topic

item.title: Please lock, fixed [ty pure n skillz!]
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Frell:

dont type a ip in the ip bar…you do not need it.

What? Yes you do, or you’ll just be playing on default (hybridscape) by yourself on 127.0.0.1 . I also suggest you format the codes in compile.bat and runserver.bat with your Java type installed to your PC. If you have any troubles, contact either of us.

And Sick of Air, that variable named “classpath” is not necessarily required…

Read full topic
item.source: Please lock, fixed [ty pure n skillz!]

item.title: Please lock, fixed [ty pure n skillz!]
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

[code]Ok before we can fix the compiler and runeserver, we need to set out variables. Ok go into start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced, then enviromental variables.

start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables

Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open. Rename it to “PATH” and then for it’s variable value (erase old one):

C:Windows\System32\;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\

You will also need to set a variables called “classpath”. Make a new variable and give it the name classpath. No add this in for it’s value:

C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\

Then edit compile.bat and replace it all with:

@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Then edit runserver.bat and replace it all with:

@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause

I know it looks kinda like the Ultimate Server Guide, but it’s edited to work with JDK 6u1. Hope it helps :)[/code]

Read full topic
